intro: Phytarrhiza duratii, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces arrowhead-shaped leaves and has a flowering structure known as an inflorescence. Its tubers, which are rich in starch, are used as a food source in some regions. The botanical features of Phytarrhiza duratii make it an important plant in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
